units.name: Autarch
units.description: Psyker hero unit that leads the Aeldari charge.
units.flavour: Autarchs have a consummate understanding of the way of the warrior, and the future of the race has been shaped by their excellence in the arts of death. They follow the Path of Command, gaining a wider appreciation of battle than any other and directing the warhost on the most efficient path to victory. Theirs is a burning obsession to see war itself conquered and made subservient to their will.

units.name: AvatarOfKhaine
units.description: Unique monstrous creature that murders enemies in close combat and sends nearby Aeldari into a merciless rage.
units.flavour: The molten demigod of war blazes from legend into reality, his almighty bellow of bloodlust fuelling an inferno in the hearts of all those Aeldari who hear it. The living Avatar is an ancient war deity incarnate, rivalled in power only by the incalculable energies of the mightiest Daemons of the immaterium. His eyes glow like embers, and as he moves, his body of burning iron crackles and spits fire, while tendrils of smoke and cinders wreath him like a dark cloak. His mere presence incites the Aeldari around him into a black and merciless rage, the fires of the Bloody-Handed God’s battle lust crackling within them.

units.name: FarseerSkyrunner
units.description: Fast jetbike psyker hero unit that debilitates enemies and restores morale.
units.flavour: The Farseers that guide each craftworld are perhaps the most powerful of all psykers. By leading the Aeldari along the paths of fate they can bring salvation or doom to entire races. They are masters of prediction, and even in battle they perform their subtle art, casting up their wraithbone runes and interpreting changes in the glowing icons as they circle in the air.

units.name: FireDragon
units.description: Heavy infantry unit that excels at engaging heavy targets in close range.
units.flavour: Shimmering with a haze of lambent fire, the Fire Dragons stride into battle. These warriors send blasts of fusion energy spearing out to incinerate their foes, turning men into pillars of flame and tanks into half-melted wrecks. Slab-sided fortresses and lumbering war machines are the prey of the Fire Dragons, and their craft is that of pure devastation.

units.name: FirePrism
units.description: Versatile skimmer unit that can cycle its guns and link them with other Fire Prisms.
units.flavour: The Fire Prism is graceful and swift, though it sacrifices none of its killing power for manoeuvrability. As it darts across the battlefield, its prism cannon fires a tight beam of blinding light that punches through the hulls of its armoured prey. At the touch of a rune the pilot recalibrates his two-stage laser array, and the cannon disperses its beam, blasting enemy infantry to scorched ruin. Sophisticated tracking arrays allow this technological wonder to channel its firepower into another prism cannon.

units.name: CrimsonHunter
units.description: Flying unit that can surgically remove even the most armoured targets.
units.flavour: Leaving a blood-hued blur in their wake, the Crimson Hunters are the assassins of the sky. Perhaps the most unusual of the Aspects of Khaine, they embody the role of the remorseless hunter, who takes wing only to bring destruction to his chosen foes. Armed with pulse lasers and bright lances capable of reducing a man to a pillar of flame in a pinpoint, stabbing beam, the Crimson Hunters can surgically remove the leaders of an enemy army in a single pass.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents a city's defenses.
units.flavour: The Webway riddles Gladius Prime, but many of the gateways have been lost. Even those that survive are unimaginably ancient, but still they stand, ignored by the younger races. Around them, the Aeldari build emplacements and machinery, to stabilise the gateways renewed connection with the immaterium and defend it against incursion.

units.name: HowlingBanshee
units.description: Agile and terrifying close combat infantry unit.
units.flavour: The Howling Banshees are a predominately female Aspect, embodying Khaine’s speed, agility and terrifying presence. They stun and confound the foe as they charge in, ensuring none can escape the energised blade of the power sword as it thrusts forward with absolute precision. To exact this sudden retribution upon their enemies the Howling Banshees move with a terrible swiftness, preparing for the charge by thinning the ranks of their victims with shuriken pistol fire.

units.name: HemlockWraithfighter
units.description: Devastating flying unit that can both protect allies and stun enemies.
units.flavour: The ethereal scream of the Hemlock Wraithfighter drives a spike of terror into the mind, and even its flitting shadow can bring a brave man to his knees. The energies that pour from this eldritch craft are born of a psychic union between the living and the dead. Each Hemlock is piloted by a Spiritseer, a powerful psyker capable of assailing the minds of those below him with morbid visions. Stranger by far is his co-pilot, for the Wraithfighter is crewed by a dead Aeldari soul who controls weapons that would drive a mortal insane. As the Wraithfighter passes over the foe, its D-scythes flare bright – a silent second later, the craft’s victims slump, their souls severed from their bodies.

units.name: Guardian
units.description: Quick basic infantry unit.
units.flavour: Clad in psycho-reactive armour and armed with lethal shuriken weaponry, the Guardians of the Aeldari armies are able warriors all. Gifted with the natural speed of the Aeldari and the determination to preserve their craftworld no matter the cost, the Guardians are more than a match for the soldiery of the lesser races.

units.name: Ranger
units.description: Stealth infantry unit that excels at taking out enemy infantry.
units.flavour: Moving like shadows through the darkness, Aeldari Rangers take up commanding positions above the battlefield, as silent and lethal as Asuryan’s withering gaze. A Ranger’s keen eyes are constantly seeking out prize targets, his subtle hand signals spelling the doom of commanders and priests. When his cross hairs flit over his target it takes only a single beat of the Aeldari’s heart to judge distance, direction and deflection before he squeezes the trigger.

units.name: Scorpion
units.description: Super-heavy skimmer unit that is unstoppable when on the move.
units.flavour: The Scorpion is an Aeldari super-heavy grav-tank utilised exclusively by the Craftworld Aeldari, and is amongst the largest vehicles recorded capable of anti-gravitic movement in the galaxy. Known to the Aeldari as one of the Engines of Vaul, it combines sophisticated and powerful weaponry with the grace and speed that have come to be associated with the Aeldari's vehicles. Protected by a Holo-Field and armed with twin-linked Pulsars, the Scorpion has earned nicknames like the “Grave-maker” and “Deathsled” from the Imperium of Man's veteran tank crews.

units.name: VaulsWrathSupportBattery
units.description: Artillery unit that can clear tiles and excels against slow targets.
units.flavour: Aeldari artillery glides forward upon broad grav-platforms, each gun’s generator thrumming low as it obliterates the craftworld’s enemies. Unlike the crude solid explosives hurled by the ordnance of lesser races, these elegant weapons of death cast forth clouds of monofilament strands, waves of sonic fury and roiling blasts of carefully contained Warp energy.

units.name: Spiritseer
units.description: Psyker hero unit that can choose to channel his abilities in two ways: either to protect or to destroy.
units.flavour: The Spiritseer has a dual existence, caught on the cusp of life and death. The power of life he delivers to the ghost warriors of the craftworlds, not only by placing the spirit stones that animate them within their wraithbone shells, but by using his psychic powers to enhance and invigorate them during battle. The gift of death he brings to those who threaten the craftworld. A simple gesture from a Spiritseer can see his enemies assailed by lithe, powerful constructs that are all but indestructible, each immortal hero burning with a cold malevolence from beyond the grave.

units.name: ShiningSpear
units.description: Expert skirmisher jetbike unit.
units.flavour: The Shining Spears ride to war upon alabaster-white jetbikes of exceptional quality, slender laser lances held lightly in their hands. Like the legendary spear of Khaine that slew with but a single blow, the Aspect Warriors strike at the heart of the enemy. Moving with blinding speed, they wend and weave through tumbled ruins and broken warzones, effortlessly anticipating every twist and turn, for they are completely at one with their soaring steeds.

units.name: WarWalker
units.description: Well-balanced and well-equipped walker unit.
units.flavour: Those that think they have escaped the main Aeldari assault are often hunted down and slain by cannon-armed War Walker squadrons. Enemy convoys are torn apart by hyper-focussed lasers before they realise they are under attack, platoons melt away under a hurricane of shuriken cannon fire, and the fighter planes of the foe are brought screaming down to earth like balls of fire hurled from the firmament.

units.name: WaveSerpent
units.description: Skimmer transport unit that can sacrifice armour to finish off targets.
units.flavour: The Wave Serpent is the primary transport of the craftworlds, though its capacity to deal death has earned it a fell reputation among the enemies of the Aeldari. Atop its turret it mounts a twin array of heavy weaponry that blasts priority targets, forcing the enemy to lie low as the grav-tank swoops down for its passengers to deploy.

units.name: Warlock
units.description: Psyker infantry unit that can teleport around the battlefield and cleanse their foes.
units.flavour: When the Warlocks of the craftworlds join their minds, the fate of worlds can hinge upon their actions. As true sons of Khaine, these militant psykers will plunge into combat at the slightest provocation. Witchblades and singing spears are swung in graceful arcs, leaving coruscating webs of energy behind them as the Conclave carves through the ranks of their adversaries. They do so with joy in their souls, for of all the seers of the Aeldari hosts, the Warlocks are the fiercest and most violent of all.

units.name: Wraithblade
units.description: Close combat infantry unit equipped with powerful ghost weapons.
units.flavour: The shimmering ghostswords and curving axes of the Wraithblades make a mockery of mortal armour. Blades swung by unnaturally strong arms hew and hack apart the mightiest of enemies with each bloody blow, while the armoured hulls of tanks cave under the power of the Wraithblades’ assault. Feared even by their living kin, these ghost warriors are exceptional shock troops, combining immense size, strength and fearlessness to create formidable warriors that can break apart a battle line with a single blood-curdling charge.

units.name: Wraithknight
units.description: Gargantuan monstrous creature that blasts its foes from range and blinds anyone who manages to get close.
units.flavour: Dominating the battlefield, the Wraithknight looks down upon its foes like a vengeful god of war. Armed with either massive energy cannons or a colossal blade and shield, this giant ghost warrior can unleash blazing destruction or charge in to carve apart its foes. Inside its wraithbone hull, its pilot communes with the soul of his twin, for this ghost warrior is driven by two Aeldari, one living and one dead, working as one.

units.name: WebwayGate
units.description: Fortification unit that allows the Aeldari to travel from one place to another.
units.flavour: A galactic tapestry of shimmering strands used by the Aeldari to traverse the stars without risking the dread realm of the warp, the webway once spanned the galaxy, even stretching out into the empty void beyond. These days are long gone. Ravaged by war and catastrophe, many of its tunnels have been torn open or amputated, and a great number of its entrances have been sealed. Despite the degradation, the Aeldari still rely upon the webway for swift travel, using webway gates to enable this.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates energy, research and influence.
buildings.flavour: Raised high above the ground, this coiled Webway opening enables Aeldari aircraft to travel straight from the immaterium to Gladius Prime whilst having a slower transition of air pressure, composition and local gravity compared to the unearthly forms present in the twisted space between the stars.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as harvests ore, generates research and increases growth.
buildings.flavour: Many of the paths that Aeldari walk in their long lives are non-violent—indeed, most are, for the Craftworld Aeldari were those who rejected the hedonistic lives of their peers for one of contemplation. Bonesingers are artisans who psychically manipulate Wraithbone into the structures and machinery that Aeldari use.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: More elegant by far than its Imperial equivalents, this portable plasma generator has been brought through the webway at great risk. It uses similar technology to the Imperial version, but has a much higher output for a much smaller device.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: The Webway riddles Gladius Prime, but many of the gateways have been lost. Even those that survive are unimaginably ancient, but still they stand, ignored by the younger races. Around them, the Aeldari build emplacements and machinery, to stabilise the gateways renewed connection with the immaterium and defend it against incursion.

buildings.name: Food
buildings.flavour: In Aeldari myth, Isha was the mother of the Aeldari, who brought them into existence and shielded them from Khaine. She is also thought to be one of the three surviving Aeldari deities, trapped in the Chaos God Nurgle’s domain. In these gardens on Gladius, Aeldari who walk the Path of the Artisan follow her teachings and grow healthy, fresh food for the local Aeldari forces. Their contribution to Aeldari life is regarded as just as valuable as any warrior or seer.

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates research and influence.
buildings.flavour: Though Asuryan was the chief deity of the Aeldari, his brother Khaine was his match in power. All warriors devote themselves to Khaine, with those who are lost on the Path of War becoming his Exarchs and Autarchs. In contrast, those lost on the Path of the Seer become Farseers, unable to return to the other paths they may have walked—and the Aeldari do not consider the sacrifice of freedom for power worthwhile.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: As Asuryan was dying, consumed by Slaanesh, he blessed the Aeldari; he gave them long life and great psychic power; but he also doomed their fertility. Over time, Aeldari numbers have dwindled until now, when the great halls that once housed millions only house thousands. Here, on Gladius Prime, the ghost halls provide a taste of luxurious Aeldari living for those not fighting in the field.

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: When one sees the tracery of wraithbone growing into the sky; when one hears an unearthly song from a labourer who has lived longer than the Imperium has existed; when one sees an elegant figure talking with authority about the future to come; perhaps you might concede that the Aeldari have good reason to behave with arrogance…

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: Eldanesh was the first Aeldari. He and his kinsman Ulthanesh were the two greatest heroes of Aeldari mythology, battling the new people’s enemies alongside Khaine, the God of War. Eventually, the two heroes fell out and Ulthanesh went his own way. But when Khaine killed Eldanesh in rage, Ulthanesh fought alongside his kinsman’s house against the god and became proverbial for his loyalty.

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry as well as generates research and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: Asuryan, the Phoenix King, was the chief of the Aeldari Gods and the last to be consumed by Slaanesh during the fall of the Aeldari. He has long been an inspiration to the Craftworld Aeldari, who often refer to themselves as ‘Asuryani’. At this muster ground, new arrivals to Gladius are equipped and assigned to squads before being tested in the field.

buildings.name: Ore
buildings.flavour: The smith god Vaul was known for his fantastic creations. Though the surviving myths focus mostly on his weapons (notably his hundred swords), he created many devices the Aeldari still use today—like this automated mine, which requires the barest supervision to extract the ore needed for his other creations.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: Here, spiritseers interrogate the spiritstones of the dead. The Aeldari do not invent and they rarely research these days—their technology is mostly stagnant, having been inherited from the Old Ones, but unlike the Imperial priesthood of Mars they do at least understand its function. Here they can consult the wisest minds of their history for solutions to any problem—though their response isn’t always clear or quick.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as harvests ore and generates research.
buildings.flavour: This extension to the Webway Portal allows larger vehicles to access Gladius Prime. Without it, the Aeldari forces would just be infantry and jetbikes—enough for a Harlequin Troupe or a Biel-Tan vanguard perhaps, but not for a true war effort.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates energy, research and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Raised high above the ground, this coiled Webway opening enables Aeldari aircraft to travel straight from the immaterium to Gladius Prime whilst having a slower transition of air pressure, composition and local gravity compared to the unearthly forms present in the twisted space between the stars.

upgrades.name: AircraftBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Portal Spires.
upgrades.flavour: The Crimson Hunters owe their allegiance to Kurnous, the Aeldari God of the Hunt. Though he is 60 million years dead, when his name is invoked they redouble their efforts, both in recruitment and construction.

upgrades.name: AsuryaniArrivalsBonus
upgrades.description: Reduces the cost of Asuryani Arrivals.
upgrades.flavour:
“My word is more than mere advice: it is an imprecation filtered through the consciousness of our storied dead, striving to bring one iota of order to the disordered universe. Our race understands that and listens to my word, not as that of a dictator but as an attentive student.”
— Farseer Kataimon of Malantai

upgrades.name: AssaultWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of assault weapons.
upgrades.flavour: The unique shuriken ammunition of the Aeldari consists of monomolecular spinning blades fired at great speed. But molecules are so limiting when there are smaller, more deadly structures to use.

upgrades.name: AsuryaniArrivalsBonus2
upgrades.description: Reduces the cooldown of Asuryani Arrivals.
upgrades.flavour:
“When the Warlocks and Farseers of multiple craftworlds share a vision—a literal vision of the future—then they and their craftworlds work as one. They will denude their own halls of life and spirit to fulfil their pledge to that future.”
— Lecture transcripts, Grigomen Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: Despite the millenia they’ve spent drifting the stars, some Rangers of the Craftworld Aeldari have passed time on the Exodite worlds and Maiden worlds, and have learned how to establish life planetside, growing food and constructing their wraithbone buildings in the ancient ways.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: Experienced Exodite construction designs are being employed by the Craftworld’s Bonesingers here. Only having worked on the ancient Craftworlds, the idea of building a city for the first time is something utterly new to their minds.

upgrades.name: AvatarOfKhaine
upgrades.description: Unique monstrous creature that murders enemies in close combat and sends nearby Aeldari into a merciless rage.
upgrades.flavour: The molten demigod of war blazes from legend into reality, his almighty bellow of bloodlust fuelling an inferno in the hearts of all those Aeldari who hear it. The living Avatar is an ancient war deity incarnate, rivalled in power only by the incalculable energies of the mightiest Daemons of the immaterium. His eyes glow like embers, and as he moves, his body of burning iron crackles and spits fire, while tendrils of smoke and cinders wreath him like a dark cloak. His mere presence incites the Aeldari around him into a black and merciless rage, the fires of the Bloody-Handed God’s battle lust crackling within them.

upgrades.name: CleansingFlame
upgrades.description: Grants Warlocks the ability to blast adjacent foes with white-hot psychic flame.
upgrades.flavour: The psyker harnesses the very fire in his soul, creating a wall of white-hot psychic flame that blasts forth and purges his foes from the battlefield.

upgrades.name: ConstructionBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Bonesinger Chantries.
upgrades.flavour: Bonesingers are rare and cherished, even among the scattered Aeldari—but they have come in numbers to the Farseer’s summons, to capture this unique planet for their dying race.

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as harvests ore, generates research and increases growth.
upgrades.flavour: Many of the paths that Aeldari walk in their long lives are non-violent—indeed, most are, for the Craftworld Aeldari were those who rejected the hedonistic lives of their peers for one of contemplation. Bonesingers are artisans who psychically manipulate Wraithbone into the structures and machinery that Aeldari use.

upgrades.name: CrackShot
upgrades.description: Increases the accuracy and armour penetration of Fire Dragons.
upgrades.flavour: The Fire Dragons are rightly feared as tank hunters and none more so than their Exarch, who leads his squad from the front, inspiring his squad to more destruction with his own devastating feats.

upgrades.name: CrystalTargetingMatrix
upgrades.description: Grants Wave Serpents, Fire Prisms and War Walkers the ability to temporarily increase their accuracy.
upgrades.flavour: Utilising advanced scanner technologies, this targeting matrix allows pinpoint fire even when on the move.

upgrades.name: Dominate
upgrades.description: Grants Hemlock Wraithfighters the ability to stun enemy units that are neither vehicles nor fortifications.
upgrades.flavour: The psyker reaches into his foe’s mind, trammelling his soul and crushing his will to fight on.

upgrades.name: ExpertHunter
upgrades.description: Increases the damage of Shining Spears against monstrous creatures, vehicles and fortifications.
upgrades.flavour: The Shining Spears weaponry might be short-ranged but their Star Lances and Laser Lances are incredibly powerful, as they weave around larger targets, spying out their weak points.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry.
upgrades.flavour: The Aeldari’s thermoplas mesh armour isn’t designed with a focus solely on defense—it also enables the user to move as freely as if it weren’t there. However, by further involuting its complex dissipation protocols, it is possible to increase its resilience with no loss of mobility.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: All Aeldari vehicles and structures are literally ‘sung’ into existence, by Bonesingers whose command of their vocal and psychic range is the constructive counterpart of the Howling Banshee’s war cry. Yet, with Gladius Prime’s resources and alteration in their internal harmonies, the Bonesingers can weave greater power into their creations, further increasing their resilience.

upgrades.name: FarseerSkyrunner
upgrades.description: Fast jetbike psyker hero unit that debilitates enemies and restores morale.
upgrades.flavour: The Farseers that guide each craftworld are perhaps the most powerful of all psykers. By leading the Aeldari along the paths of fate they can bring salvation or doom to entire races. They are masters of prediction, and even in battle they perform their subtle art, casting up their wraithbone runes and interpreting changes in the glowing icons as they circle in the air.

upgrades.name: FireDragon
upgrades.description: Heavy infantry unit that excels at engaging heavy targets in close range.
upgrades.flavour: Shimmering with a haze of lambent fire, the Fire Dragons stride into battle. These warriors send blasts of fusion energy spearing out to incinerate their foes, turning men into pillars of flame and tanks into half-melted wrecks. Slab-sided fortresses and lumbering war machines are the prey of the Fire Dragons, and their craft is that of pure devastation.

upgrades.name: FirePrism
upgrades.description: Versatile skimmer unit that can cycle its guns and link them with other Fire Prisms.
upgrades.flavour: The Fire Prism is graceful and swift, though it sacrifices none of its killing power for manoeuvrability. As it darts across the battlefield, its prism cannon fires a tight beam of blinding light that punches through the hulls of its armoured prey. At the touch of a rune the pilot recalibrates his two-stage laser array, and the cannon disperses its beam, blasting enemy infantry to scorched ruin. Sophisticated tracking arrays allow this technological wonder to channel its firepower into another prism cannon.

upgrades.name: FoodBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the food output of Isha's Gardens.
upgrades.flavour: So intensely do the Aeldari feel that even their basic foodstuffs are works of art, cultivated by craftsmen that have spent millenia perfecting their cuisine. With a wider range of ingredients and seasonings, they can work miracles with the seeming simplest foodstuffs.

upgrades.name: GhostwalkMatrix
upgrades.description: Allows Wave Serpents, Fire Prisms and War Walkers to move through cover.
upgrades.flavour: A ghostwalk matrix utilises the knowledge and wisdom contained within a spirit stone to guide the vehicle on its path.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants Shining Spears, Farseer Skyrunners, Avatar of Khaine, War Walkers and Wraithknights the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: HeavyWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst humanity’s plasma weaponry is often fatal to its users, the elegant Aeldari equivalents harbour no such threats. And now a chance discovery on Gladius Prime’s surface has allowed the Bonesingers and Exarchs to further improve their focus.

upgrades.name: HemlockWraithfighter
upgrades.description: Devastating flying unit that can both protect allies and stun enemies.
upgrades.flavour: The ethereal scream of the Hemlock Wraithfighter drives a spike of terror into the mind, and even its flitting shadow can bring a brave man to his knees. The energies that pour from this eldritch craft are born of a psychic union between the living and the dead. Each Hemlock is piloted by a Spiritseer, a powerful psyker capable of assailing the minds of those below him with morbid visions. Stranger by far is his co-pilot, for the Wraithfighter is crewed by a dead Aeldari soul who controls weapons that would drive a mortal insane. As the Wraithfighter passes over the foe, its D-scythes flare bright – a silent second later, the craft’s victims slump, their souls severed from their bodies.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates research and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Though Asuryan was the chief deity of the Aeldari, his brother Khaine was his match in power. All warriors devote themselves to Khaine, with those who are lost on the Path of War becoming his Exarchs and Autarchs. In contrast, those lost on the Path of the Seer become Farseers, unable to return to the other paths they may have walked—and the Aeldari do not consider the sacrifice of freedom for power worthwhile.

upgrades.name: HoloFields
upgrades.description: Grants Wave Serpents and Fire Prisms invulnerable damage reduction after having moved.
upgrades.flavour: Harnessing kinetic energy to shimmer and distort the vehicle’s silhouette, holo-fields prevent the foe from accurately targeting the craft as it sweeps across the battlefield.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: As Asuryan was dying, consumed by Slaanesh, he blessed the Aeldari; he gave them long life and great psychic power; but he also doomed their fertility. Over time, Aeldari numbers have dwindled until now, when the great halls that once housed millions only house thousands. Here, on Gladius Prime, the ghost halls provide a taste of luxurious Aeldari living for those not fighting in the field.

upgrades.name: HowlingBanshee
upgrades.description: Agile and terrifying close combat infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: The Howling Banshees are a predominately female Aspect, embodying Khaine’s speed, agility and terrifying presence. They stun and confound the foe as they charge in, ensuring none can escape the energised blade of the power sword as it thrusts forward with absolute precision. To exact this sudden retribution upon their enemies the Howling Banshees move with a terrible swiftness, preparing for the charge by thinning the ranks of their victims with shuriken pistol fire.

upgrades.name: InfantryBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Asuryan's Crucibles.
upgrades.flavour: Asurmen is the founder of the path of the Warrior and the first of the Phoenix Lords, the creators of the Aspect Shrines. Invoking his name will surely bring more warriors to Gladius Prime, to seize this planet for the Aeldari.

upgrades.name: InfluenceBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the influence output of Domes of the Seers.
upgrades.flavour: Very few mortal beings have ever had the foresight of a Farseer—a power perhaps derived from the lost Aeldari goddess Lileath, who predicted the death of the gods at the hands of the mortal Aeldari. An oracle that invokes her name draws the eyes of all Aeldari upon you…

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: Eldanesh was the first Aeldari. He and his kinsman Ulthanesh were the two greatest heroes of Aeldari mythology, battling the new people’s enemies alongside Khaine, the God of War. Eventually, the two heroes fell out and Ulthanesh went his own way. But when Khaine killed Eldanesh in rage, Ulthanesh fought alongside his kinsman’s house against the god and became proverbial for his loyalty.

upgrades.name: MarksmansEye
upgrades.description: Increases the accuracy of Crimson Hunters.
upgrades.flavour: Only a Crimson Hunter would consider piloting the fastest, most manuevrable Aeldari craft to involve so little challenge, that they also are able to aim and fire three separate weapons with differing fire rates at the same time.

upgrades.name: MeleeWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.
upgrades.flavour: The monomolecular filaments and blades of the Aeldari are lethal enough by themselves, but with the smallest addition of phasing technology (as used in the Harlequin’s Caress), they pass through even the thickest armour.

upgrades.name: OreBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the ore output of Altmarls of Vaul.
upgrades.flavour: The Aeldari require metals less than other races, given that almost all of their structures and vehicles are psychic energy made tangible, in the form of wraithbone. But for the small amount they need, there are always improvements to be made.

upgrades.name: PlasmaGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Guardians and Autarchs the ability to throw versatile grenades.
upgrades.flavour: Plasma grenades are a highly advanced type of assault grenade, commonly employed by the Aeldari.

upgrades.name: Ranger
upgrades.description: Stealth infantry unit that excels at taking out enemy infantry.
upgrades.flavour: Moving like shadows through the darkness, Aeldari Rangers take up commanding positions above the battlefield, as silent and lethal as Asuryan’s withering gaze. A Ranger’s keen eyes are constantly seeking out prize targets, his subtle hand signals spelling the doom of commanders and priests. When his cross hairs flit over his target it takes only a single beat of the Aeldari’s heart to judge distance, direction and deflection before he squeezes the trigger.

upgrades.name: ResearchBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the research output of Spirit Ossuaries.
upgrades.flavour: The Farseers of the Black Library dispatched us on this errand and now they offer their support. With access to their archives, we should be able to rediscover lost technologies and more rapidly improve our foothold on this planet.

upgrades.name: Scorpion
upgrades.description: Super-heavy skimmer unit that is unstoppable when on the move.
upgrades.flavour: The Scorpion is an Aeldari super-heavy grav-tank utilised exclusively by the Craftworld Aeldari, and is amongst the largest vehicles recorded capable of anti-gravitic movement in the galaxy. Known to the Aeldari as one of the Engines of Vaul, it combines sophisticated and powerful weaponry with the grace and speed that have come to be associated with the Aeldari's vehicles. Protected by a Holo-Field and armed with twin-linked Pulsars, the Scorpion has earned nicknames like the “Grave-maker” and “Deathsled” from the Imperium of Man's veteran tank crews.

upgrades.name: SpiritPreservationBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the energy gain when Aeldari units die.
upgrades.flavour: For time immemorial, we have mounted our spirit stones in simple casings, trusting to the skill of their owners to preserve them. Yet, the ancient webway structures we have encountered on Gladius Prime demonstrate that a complex shielding can be built into any wraithbone casing, allowing us to snatch a greater number of our dead warriors from the maw of She Who Waits.

upgrades.name: Spiritseer
upgrades.description: Psyker hero unit that can choose to channel his abilities in two ways: either to protect or to destroy.
upgrades.flavour: The Spiritseer has a dual existence, caught on the cusp of life and death. The power of life he delivers to the ghost warriors of the craftworlds, not only by placing the spirit stones that animate them within their wraithbone shells, but by using his psychic powers to enhance and invigorate them during battle. The gift of death he brings to those who threaten the craftworld. A simple gesture from a Spiritseer can see his enemies assailed by lithe, powerful constructs that are all but indestructible, each immortal hero burning with a cold malevolence from beyond the grave.

upgrades.name: SpiritStones
upgrades.description: Reduces the morale loss of Wave Serpents, Fire Prisms and War Walkers.
upgrades.flavour: Some Aeldari vehicles incorporate large spirit stones with a captive animus that can control the vehicle should it be disabled.

upgrades.name: StarEngines
upgrades.description: Increases the movement of Wave Serpents, Fire Prisms, War Walkers and Scorpions.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst all Aeldari vehicles are swift and agile, those that mount star engines are often able to move faster than the eye can follow. Lesser races can only marvel at the phenomenal speed and manoeuvrability of a craft so equipped.

upgrades.name: TranscendentBliss
upgrades.description: Grants cities the ability to spend influence for a temporary increase in loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: The life of an Aeldari is infinitely richer than that of a human, given their tremendous sensitivity, intellect and intensity of feeling—and sometimes it takes shared moments of that bliss to remind the Aeldari what they’re fighting for in this dark universe.

upgrades.name: TranscendentBlissBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the loyalty gain from Transcendent Bliss.
upgrades.flavour:
“To an unfettered Aeldari mind there is neither sanity nor madness, but merely a wave of perfect existence fulfilled by its own savage momentum.”
— Ralamine Mung, Ordo Xenos

upgrades.name: VaulsWrathSupportBattery
upgrades.description: Artillery unit that can clear tiles and excels against slow targets.
upgrades.flavour: Aeldari artillery glides forward upon broad grav-platforms, each gun’s generator thrumming low as it obliterates the craftworld’s enemies. Unlike the crude solid explosives hurled by the ordnance of lesser races, these elegant weapons of death cast forth clouds of monofilament strands, waves of sonic fury and roiling blasts of carefully contained Warp energy.

upgrades.name: VectoredEngines
upgrades.description: Grants Wave Serpents, Fire Prisms, War Walkers and Scorpions the ability to temporarily increase their armour against enemy ranged weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Vectored engines allow the pilot of an Aeldari vehicle to rapidly alter its facing, placing deadly weapons, or stronger armour, to the fore. Often, this can mean the difference between sustaining critical damage and taking an indirect blow that can soon be shrugged off.

upgrades.name: VehicleBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Greater Ingresses.
upgrades.flavour: A spirit stone recovered from Gladius proved to be that of an ancient Bonesinger, lost here millenia past. With their insights into the planet’s structure and resources, we’re able to greatly increase our production.

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as harvests ore and generates research.
upgrades.flavour: This extension to the Webway Portal allows larger vehicles to access Gladius Prime. Without it, the Aeldari forces would just be infantry and jetbikes—enough for a Harlequin Troupe or a Biel-Tan vanguard perhaps, but not for a true war effort.

upgrades.name: Warlock
upgrades.description: Psyker infantry unit that can teleport around the battlefield and cleanse their foes.
upgrades.flavour: When the Warlocks of the craftworlds join their minds, the fate of worlds can hinge upon their actions. As true sons of Khaine, these militant psykers will plunge into combat at the slightest provocation. Witchblades and singing spears are swung in graceful arcs, leaving coruscating webs of energy behind them as the Conclave carves through the ranks of their adversaries. They do so with joy in their souls, for of all the seers of the Aeldari hosts, the Warlocks are the fiercest and most violent of all.

upgrades.name: WarShout
upgrades.description: Grants Howling Banshees the ability to demoralize adjacent enemies.
upgrades.flavour: In Aeldari mythology, banshees foreshadow the death of warriors with their howl. The Howling Banshee aspect warriors wear a specialised mask that amplifies and weaponises their thoughts into psychic screams. Whilst their foes are stunned, the Banshees close, power swords at the ready…

upgrades.name: WarWalker
upgrades.description: Well-balanced and well-equipped walker unit.
upgrades.flavour: Those that think they have escaped the main Aeldari assault are often hunted down and slain by cannon-armed War Walker squadrons. Enemy convoys are torn apart by hyper-focussed lasers before they realise they are under attack, platoons melt away under a hurricane of shuriken cannon fire, and the fighter planes of the foe are brought screaming down to earth like balls of fire hurled from the firmament.

upgrades.name: WaveSerpent
upgrades.description: Skimmer transport unit that can sacrifice armour to finish off targets.
upgrades.flavour: The Wave Serpent is the primary transport of the craftworlds, though its capacity to deal death has earned it a fell reputation among the enemies of the Aeldari. Atop its turret it mounts a twin array of heavy weaponry that blasts priority targets, forcing the enemy to lie low as the grav-tank swoops down for its passengers to deploy.

upgrades.name: WebwayGateBonus
upgrades.description: Removes the cost of activating Webway Gates.
upgrades.flavour: Only the Harlequins and the custodians of the Black Library truly know anything of the Webway’s transdimensional layout. But by gifting us a portion of that knowledge, pertaining only to this world, the Librarians have ensured we can re-open these ancient gates with ease.

upgrades.name: WebwayGateBonus2
upgrades.description: Removes the action cost from Webway Travel.
upgrades.flavour: Having received guidance from the Black Library on Gladius’ unique Webway layout, the spiritseers have planned out the shortest paths between any two gates, making the path between them as frictionless as any other step we might take.

upgrades.name: WebwayRedoubt
upgrades.description: Grants the ability to found new cities on claimed Webway Gates.
upgrades.flavour: To preserve the ancient Webway gates on Gladius, the Aeldari know that they must protect them. These rapidly-constructed Redoubts provide some defenses, drawing on the Webway’s limitless power to devastate any enemies foolish enough to venture near.

upgrades.name: Wraithblade
upgrades.description: Close combat infantry unit equipped with powerful ghost weapons.
upgrades.flavour: The shimmering ghostswords and curving axes of the Wraithblades make a mockery of mortal armour. Blades swung by unnaturally strong arms hew and hack apart the mightiest of enemies with each bloody blow, while the armoured hulls of tanks cave under the power of the Wraithblades’ assault. Feared even by their living kin, these ghost warriors are exceptional shock troops, combining immense size, strength and fearlessness to create formidable warriors that can break apart a battle line with a single blood-curdling charge.

upgrades.name: Wraithknight
upgrades.description: Gargantuan monstrous creature that blasts its foes from range and blinds anyone who manages to get close.
upgrades.flavour: Dominating the battlefield, the Wraithknight looks down upon its foes like a vengeful god of war. Armed with either massive energy cannons or a colossal blade and shield, this giant ghost warrior can unleash blazing destruction or charge in to carve apart its foes. Inside its wraithbone hull, its pilot communes with the soul of his twin, for this ghost warrior is driven by two Aeldari, one living and one dead, working as one.

upgrades.name: WraithknightStarcannon
upgrades.description: Grants Wraithknights two Starcannons.
upgrades.flavour: It is a testament to the idiocy of Man that he creates plasma weapons that frequently maim or kill the wielder. Starcannons and suncannons have no such flaw, their plasma cores producing the heat of a star while the guns remain cool to the touch.
